data.question: What is the chemical formula of EP-1?
What method was used to synthesize Dipotassium Tetranitroethide (EP-3)?
data.answer: Dipotassium Tetranitroethide (EP-3) was synthesized by adding tetraiodoethylene powder to HNO3, followed by extraction with dichloromethane, washing, and filtration.

data.question: What is the crystal system of EP-7?
Is the density of EP-5 higher than 3 g/cm3?
What is the peak temperature of the exothermic peak for EP-4 during thermal decomposition?
Does EP-8 have a cubic crystal system?
What is the flame color of EP-1 when burned?
What is the coordination environment around a Ca cation in EP-7?
data.answer: Each Ca cation is octa-coordinated by four oxygen atoms of water molecules and four further oxygen atoms of two TNE ligands.

data.question: Are EP-3, EP-4, EP-5, and EP-8 sensitive to mechanical stimulation?
What is the impact sensitivity of EP-9?
Does EP-6 have a triclinic space group?
What is the density of EP-2 at 298 K?
What is the method used for the preparation of alkaline earth metal salts?
data.answer: By the replacement reaction of alkaline earth metal perchlorate and dipotassium TNE.

data.question: Is the thermal decomposition process of EP-6 mainly divided into two stages?
What is the crystal system of EP-8?
What is the peak temperature of the endothermic peak for EP-9 during thermal decomposition?
Does EP-7 crystallize in a tetragonal space group?
What is the coordination environment around a Mg cation in EP-6?
data.answer: A common complex anion contains a Mg cation and six water molecules in the asymmetric unit of EP-6.
